document.title: COLLEGE AND CAREER READY STANDARDS Indiana Academic Standards World Languages East Asian Languages 2019

50D3216624604B79BA7083477ACA88AC.description: I can set goals for the progress I intend to achieve during the term.

A71A64D29FF648C1833BD0B40496A509.description:
Lifelong Learning - Learners set goals and reflect on their progress in using
languages for enjoyment, enrichment, and advancement.

11CBDDF8B6FD4C2E97C375D254FF6B3B.description:
I can correctly address people in the target language (e.g., students know how to address
teachers in the target language).

51C643D1F69246B39F0BB3587CFEFE51.description: I can introduce myself to speakers of the target language in a social community.

6980CDD4116448A3B59E9695E789714A.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can use the target language both within and beyond the classroom
to interact and learn in my community and in the globalized world.

A2E0FC42893049C6A589A73441D0EC00.description:
School and Global - Learners use the language both within and beyond the
classroom to interact and collaborate in their community and the globalized world.

5681FFCE936A46F8A9A167461C703373.description:
Communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in
multilingual communities at home and around the world.

2369586E46CE40F3BCF183EB5E369543.description:
I can explain the differences in writing systems between my native language and
the target language. EX: Pinyin, simplified/ traditional Chinese characters; Hiragana, Katakana,
Kanji.

16F746661DC943E6AD6F55180B233E17.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify differences and similarities between my own language
and the target language.

40566D2791AF432ABED4837248E0D6EB.description:
Language Comparisons - Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and
reflect on the nature of the language through comparisons of the cultures studied with their own.

AEC6201C6FA949F39364539AA7A225F8.description:
I can explain the similarities and differences of popular hobbies in my community
and the target culture.

3034DE8AE6934FD4ADB409C6E872509D.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify differences and similarities between my community and
cultures of the target language.

6750D96E14364337A7256D391BBFA38E.description:
Cultural Comparisons - Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and
reflect on the concept of culture through comparisons of the cultures studied with their own.

2B2E7FE5F58E493DA2CAB16B914816BA.description:
Develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with
cultural competence.

097ECC906D5A40E7A0F91119F0E79A5B.description: I can reinforce my skills in mathematics using numbers in the target language.

3FD4586DB366420A83CA9ACB0F901536.description:
I can reinforce my geography skills using maps of the target language and
culture.

BF6E3DF87F484364A9B855757588A231.description: Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can connect content from the target language to other disciplines

E5566FD7F4144569A44857BEDFFD6EE0.description:
Making Connections - Learners build, reinforce, and expand their knowledge of
other disciplines while using the language to develop critical thinking and to solve problems creatively.

4D6A87AA354647E28ED3568E2D6FA8A4.description:
I can access basic information and evaluate views on topics such as hobbies,
everyday activities and life such as the school day, cultural meaning of colors and numbers,
meals, and daily routines.

52AB296F3BCD4238B0F8BC9899509700.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can access and evaluate basic information and perspectives that are
available through the target languages and its cultures.

7E27998207A447E5B0C991E9A2B33B61.description:
Acquiring Information and Diverse Perspectives - Learners access and
evaluate information and diverse perspectives that are available through language and its cultures.

A225891240464FE4BEB2D8DC1C69D333.description:
Connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in
order to use the language to function in academic and career-related situations.

FD7ADE64D08645979B49E48FC05DD171.description:
In my own and other cultures I can identify some typical practices related to
familiar everyday life.

47194364F7FD4406A6B1F45DBA9BFA26.description:
In my own and other cultures I can identify some typical products related to
familiar everyday life.

A65E6D924F874DE6AC684D4805177A37.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - In my own and other cultures, I can identify products and practices to
help me understand perspectives in the target cultures.

D9E0C6E122F749CDAE88077CB9DC6C42.description:
Relating Cultural Practices and Products to Perspectives (Investigate)-
Learners use language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices and
products to perspectives of the target cultures.

F6D35E99483C4F4C9B6B4FE52CB29DB5.description:
I can use appropriate rehearsed behaviors and recognize some obviously inappropriate
behaviors in familiar everyday situations.

DF59D313596845CABD5D7206656CFAB0.description: can explain that different thinking patterns cause differences in communication.

0627AF497BBE48A1A055F4D057200AA6.description:
I can communicate with others from the target culture in familiar everyday situations using
memorized language and showing basic cultural awareness.

14D2C613117A427EA226BEC464323D63.description: Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can interact at a survival level in some familiar everyday contexts.

2582786E6F044DF08E95860A853D918D.description:
Relating to Other Cultures by Interacting - Learners use language to interact
with others in and from another culture.

3522A549DE3F4DB182169E26F18ED008.description: Interact with cultural competence and understanding.

0112D7BC2D044124B9FF898DB76BF87A.description: I can present on familiar and everyday topics, using simple sentences most of the time.

4B2184BBDCB841FEA1F6D9A67A8967E7.description:
I can express my preferences on familiar and everyday topics of interest, using simple
sentences most of the time.

4333372593E045E7BC54B425FB75BD49.description:
I can present personal information about my life and activities, using simple sentences most
of the time.

983918BC62CC40D5BEA352F9E90AE7CA.description:
I can present on very familiar and everyday topics using a mixture of practiced or memorized
words, phrases and simple sentences.

5E697E8A3A22472BA717079DFD59E6CA.description:
I can express my likes and dislikes on very familiar and everyday topics of interest, using a
mixture of practiced or memorized words, phrases and simple sentences.

9466A549A8D843E5A98E6FAF4496C4BC.description:
I can present information about myself, my interests and my activities using a mixture of
practiced or memorized words, phrases and simple sentences.

3CBA1F79B16A4C35921E2E95110B4864.description:
I can name very familiar people, places, and objects using practiced or memorized words
and phrases, with the help of gestures or visuals.

E619E54915914CB6B8A24B899BA4451C.description:
I can express my likes and dislikes using practiced or memorized words and phrases, with
the help of gestures or visuals.

A1665C0815A5466588C550991E9ADA1C.description:
I can introduce myself using practiced or memorized words and phrases, with the help of
gestures or visuals.

9C68A126AB724876AD448B117653CAD1.description:
Presentational: Learners present information, concepts, and ideas to inform,
explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media and adapting to various
audiences of listeners, readers, or viewers.

3D821CF6847F424EA7C318E87432473E.description:
I can understand familiar questions and statements from simple sentences in
conversations.

3596AA3C087540BDA28A31A3C73A6EDB.description:
I can identify the topic and some isolated elements from simple sentences in
short fictional texts.

CDD783555CA4473ABA821EF6D6EA934A.description:
I can identify the topic and some isolated facts from simple sentences in
informational texts.

D7406425F0AC45A8970088636A52F4D6.description:
I can identify some basic facts from memorized words and phrases when they are
supported by gestures or visuals in conversations.

14092B10E05549EFAA919E4371502E30.description:
I can identify some basic facts from memorized words and phrases when they are
supported by gestures or visuals in fictional texts.

CA4C132093B549BD83422256B0F840EE.description:
I can identify some basic facts from memorized words and phrases when they are
supported by gestures or visuals in informational texts.

B9B97710500F4759AF5AEF49A7DFA9E4.description:
I can understand memorized or familiar words when they are supported by gestures or
visuals in conversations.

1FD376DDA6E34E6085CAC1FE896DA151.description: I can identify memorized or familiar words when they are supported by gestures or visuals in fictional texts.

599D8DF3BCC3472EBD1FC8CB1181BEBA.description:
I can identify memorized or familiar words when they are supported by gestures or visuals
in informational texts.

6A1A07E4166C460A92BDE4E3BB77BD81.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify the general topic and some basic information in both very
familiar and everyday contexts by recognizing practiced or memorized words, phrases, and simple
sentences in texts that are spoken, written, or signed.

25F6C89ECF3C4448A01ABB3F7514E212.description:
Interpretive: Learners understand, interpret, and analyze what is heard, read, or
viewed on a variety of topics.

D4533CA44C224C278BC50EE2C99C104C.description:
I can express my own preferences or feelings and react to those of others, using a
mixture of practiced or memorized words, phrases, and questions.

033F18251D204DE8A5C3E9DC6D188441.description:
I can express basic needs related to familiar and everyday activities, using a mixture of
practiced or memorized words, phrases, and questions.

1367CF3ED74149D6AE2583388856CD49.description:
I can request and provide information by asking and answering a few simple questions
on very familiar and everyday topics, using a mixture of practiced or memorized words, phrases, and
simple sentences.

1F017913FB9A4DD5AC23C8B08AF55200.description:
I can express my own preferences or feelings and react to those of others, using a
mixture of practiced or memorized words, phrases, and questions.

FC7735A47048444EBECAB2A297C563EC.description:
I can express basic needs related to familiar and everyday activities, using a mixture of
practiced or memorized words, phrases, and questions.

5B20BDA6AED94D6D97A29E75F93A7752.description:
I can request and provide information by asking and answering a few simple questions
on very familiar and everyday topics, using a mixture of practiced or memorized words, phrases, and
simple sentences.

B1EBE7E71C7947DFACFE2FE5DF28433B.description:
I can express basic preferences or feelings, using practiced or memorized words and
phrases, with the help of gestures or visuals.

DFBDCDCBAABF4F46816BB2B6768D2B16.description:
I can express some basic needs, using practiced or memorized words and phrases, with
the help of gestures or visuals.

C5D2A771E1C447EC94C5D2526AD7E6E0.description:
I can provide information by answering a few simple questions on very familiar topics,
using practiced or memorized words and phrases, with the help of gestures or visuals.

061F38FD227F4A3BACB93504962AB98F.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can communicate in spontaneous, written, or signed conversations on
both very familiar and everyday topics using a variety of practiced or memorized words, phrases, simple
sentences, and questions.

91B466EB0654498599C74DB2E7CB4AC4.description:
Interpersonal: Learners interact and negotiate meaning in spoken, signed, or
written conversations to share information, reactions, feelings, and opinions.

A32E3201AF6E4C9CBA90CBAFBEFE51D0.description:
Communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a
variety of situations and for multiple purposes.
